input: How can I improve my CIBIL score?
output:
**CIBIL Score Improvement Guide:**

**What is CIBIL Score?**
- Range: 300-900
- Good: 750+
- Excellent: 800+
- Affects: Loan approval & interest rates

**10 Ways to Improve:**

**1. Pay Bills on Time** (35% weightage)
- Credit card bills before due date
- EMIs on time
- Set auto-pay

**2. Keep Credit Utilization Low** (30% weightage)
- Use <30% of credit limit
- Example: â‚¹1 lakh limit = Use max â‚¹30,000

**3. Maintain Old Accounts** (15% weightage)
- Don't close old credit cards
- Longer credit history = better score

**4. Limit Hard Inquiries** (10% weightage)
- Don't apply for multiple loans
- Space out applications by 6 months

**5. Mix of Credit** (10% weightage)
- Have both secured (home) & unsecured (credit card)
- Balanced portfolio

**6. Check Report Regularly**
- Free annual report from CIBIL
- Dispute errors immediately

**7. Pay More Than Minimum**
- Pay full credit card balance
- Avoid revolving credit

**8. Don't Max Out Cards**
- Keep buffer of 50%
- Better to have 2 cards with low usage

**9. Become Authorized User**
- Add to family member's good account

**10. Settle Dues**
- Clear all outstanding dues
- Avoid settlements (marks as negative)

**Timeline:**
- 3 months: +20-30 points
- 6 months: +50-70 points
- 12 months: +100-150 points

**Score Impact on Loans:**
- 750-900: 8-9% interest
- 700-749: 9-10% interest
- 650-699: 10-12% interest
- <650: Loan rejection or 12%+ interest

**Example:** On â‚¹20 lakh loan
- 750 score (8.5%): EMI â‚¹17,252
- 650 score (11%): EMI â‚¹20,647
- **Difference:** â‚¹3,395/month = â‚¹8.15 lakh over 20 years!

**Key Financial Regulations in India (2024):**

**1. Income Tax Rules**
- Tax filing deadline: July 31
- PAN mandatory for transactions >â‚¹50,000
- TDS on salary, interest, rent
- Advance tax if liability >â‚¹10,000

**2. GST Rules**
- 5%, 12%, 18%, 28% slabs
- Registration mandatory if turnover >â‚¹40 lakh
- Monthly/quarterly returns

**3. Banking Rules**
- KYC mandatory for all accounts
- Cash deposit >â‚¹50,000/day needs PAN
- Cash withdrawal >â‚¹1 crore/year = TDS
- Minimum balance requirements

**4. Investment Limits**
- PPF: Max â‚¹1.5 lakh/year
- NPS: No limit (tax benefit â‚¹2 lakh)
- ELSS: No limit (80C benefit â‚¹1.5 lakh)
- Sukanya: Max â‚¹1.5 lakh/year

**5. Loan Rules**
- Home loan: Max 80% LTV
- Personal loan: Max â‚¹40 lakh
- Credit card: Min 5% payment
- Foreclosure: No charges after 6 months

**6. Insurance Rules**
- Motor insurance: Mandatory
- Health portability: After 1 year
- Claim settlement: Within 30 days
- Free look period: 15-30 days

**7. Property Rules**
- Stamp duty: 5-7% (state-wise)
- Registration: 1% of value
- Capital gains: LTCG 20% (>2 years)
- TDS: 1% on sale >â‚¹50 lakh

**8. Digital Payment Rules**
- UPI: Free up to â‚¹1 lakh/transaction
- NEFT/RTGS: Free
- Cash transactions >â‚¹2 lakh: Prohibited

**9. Senior Citizen Benefits**
- Higher FD rates (+0.5%)
- Tax exemption: â‚¹3 lakh (old regime)
- Health deduction: â‚¹50,000 (80D)
- SCSS: 8.2% interest

**10. Penalties**
- Late tax filing: â‚¹5,000-10,000
- Wrong PAN: Transaction rejected
- Loan default: CIBIL impact
- Insurance lapse: No claim

**Recent Changes (2024):**
- New tax regime default
- Standard deduction: â‚¹50,000
- Leave encashment: â‚¹25 lakh exempt
- TDS on crypto: 1%

input: What is PMAY and how does it help in home loans?
output:
**Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) - Credit Linked Subsidy Scheme:**

**What is PMAY?**
Government scheme to provide affordable housing for all by providing interest subsidy on home loans.

**Eligibility Categories:**

**1. EWS (Economically Weaker Section):**
- Annual Income: Up to â‚¹3 lakh
- Subsidy: 6.50% on loan up to â‚¹6 lakh
- Max Subsidy: â‚¹2,67,280
- Carpet Area: Up to 30 sq.m (323 sq.ft)

**2. LIG (Lower Income Group):**
- Annual Income: â‚¹3-6 lakh
- Subsidy: 6.50% on loan up to â‚¹6 lakh
- Max Subsidy: â‚¹2,67,280
- Carpet Area: Up to 60 sq.m (646 sq.ft)

**3. MIG-I (Middle Income Group-I):**
- Annual Income: â‚¹6-12 lakh
- Subsidy: 4% on loan up to â‚¹9 lakh
- Max Subsidy: â‚¹2,35,068
- Carpet Area: Up to 160 sq.m (1722 sq.ft)

**4. MIG-II (Middle Income Group-II):**
- Annual Income: â‚¹12-18 lakh
- Subsidy: 3% on loan up to â‚¹12 lakh
- Max Subsidy: â‚¹2,30,156
- Carpet Area: Up to 200 sq.m (2153 sq.ft)

**How Subsidy Works:**

**Example - MIG-I:**
- Loan Amount: â‚¹25 lakh
- Interest Rate: 8.50% p.a.
- Tenure: 20 years

**Without PMAY:**
- EMI: â‚¹21,695
- Total Interest: â‚¹27,06,800

**With PMAY (4% subsidy on â‚¹9 lakh):**
- Effective Rate: 4.50% on â‚¹9 lakh, 8.50% on â‚¹16 lakh
- EMI: â‚¹19,460
- Total Interest: â‚¹24,71,732
- **Savings: â‚¹2,35,068**

**Eligibility Criteria:**
- First-time home buyer
- No pucca house in family name
- Not availed central government housing scheme
- Annual income within limits
- Property in PMAY approved project

**Documents Required:**
- Income Certificate
- Aadhaar Card
- PAN Card
- Property documents
- Bank statements
- Salary slips/ITR

**Application Process:**
1. Check eligibility on PMAY website
2. Apply through bank/HFC
3. Submit documents
4. Get loan approval
5. Subsidy credited upfront

**Participating Banks:**
- SBI, HDFC, ICICI, Axis, PNB
- All major banks and HFCs
- 50+ lenders

**Key Points:**
- Subsidy given upfront (reduces principal)
- One-time benefit per family
- Valid till scheme ends
- Can be combined with state schemes

**PMAY vs Regular Loan (â‚¹25 lakh, 20 years):**

| Aspect | Regular | PMAY (MIG-I) |
